setEnabled(boolean).Description: Sets a boolean that will enable or disable the fragment's UI components when it's in @B_com#google#android#gms#wallet#fragment#WalletFragmentState#READY_E@. The UI components can not be disabled in other states and the boolean has no effect. This method is meant for temporarily disabling the buy button while you load data or update UI in your app.

updateMaskedWalletRequest(com.google.and.Description: Modifies the @B_com#google#android#gms#wallet#MaskedWalletRequest_E@. This should be called after @B_com#google#android#gms#wallet#fragment#SupportWalletFragment#initialize_E@. Any non-null request passed in here takes precedence over the @B_com#google#android#gms#wallet#MaskedWalletRequest_E@ in @B_com#google#android#gms#wallet#fragment#WalletFragmentInitParams_E@ passed in @B_com#google#android#gms#wallet#fragment#SupportWalletFragment#initialize_E@. Note that any user buy button click event before this method call would load a masked wallet using whatever @B_com#google#android#gms#wallet#MaskedWalletRequest_E@ available at that time.

This should be called after @B_com#google#android#gms#wallet#fragment#SupportWalletFragment#initialize_E@. Any non-null maskedWallet passed in here takes precedence over the @B_com#google#android#gms#wallet#MaskedWallet_E@ in @B_com#google#android#gms#wallet#fragment#WalletFragmentInitParams_E@ passed in @B_com#google#android#gms#wallet#fragment#SupportWalletFragment#initialize_E@.

onActivityResult(int, int, android.conte.FullName: public void onActivityResult (int requestCode, int resultCode, Intent data)

ClassDesc: This fragment is the simplest way to place a Wallet buy button or selection details UI in an application for the InstantBuy API. It automatically handles life cycle and user events, producing a @B_com#google#android#gms#wallet#MaskedWallet_E@ in the end. Being a fragment, the component can be added to an activity's layout with the XML below. Buy Button mode: @B_com#google#android#gms#wallet#fragment#SupportWalletFragment#newInstance_E@ and added to the activity's fragment manager. The fragment must be initialized exactly once by calling @B_com#google#android#gms#wallet#fragment#SupportWalletFragment#initialize_E@. This sets a @B_com#google#android#gms#wallet#MaskedWalletRequest_E@ for buy button mode or @B_com#google#android#gms#wallet#MaskedWallet_E@ for selection details mode. For buy button mode the request may be modified with @B_com#google#android#gms#wallet#fragment#SupportWalletFragment#updateMaskedWalletRequest_E@. When the button is clicked, the masked payment credentials of the user will be retrieved and returned in your activity's onActivityResult callback with a request code specified in @B_com#google#android#gms#wallet#fragment#WalletFragmentInitParams_E@. The fragment may be in one of four states at any time. It starts out in @B_com#google#android#gms#wallet#fragment#WalletFragmentState#UNINITIALIZED_E@. UI components are disabled in this state. Once @B_com#google#android#gms#wallet#fragment#SupportWalletFragment#initialize_E@ is called, the fragment transitions into @B_com#google#android#gms#wallet#fragment#WalletFragmentState#READY_E@, where it is ready for user interaction. When the buy/change button is clicked, it transitions into @B_com#google#android#gms#wallet#fragment#WalletFragmentState#PROCESSING_E@. The button will be disabled to prevent further user interaction. Finally when the masked wallet result comes back, the fragment goes back into @B_com#google#android#gms#wallet#fragment#WalletFragmentState#READY_E@. Sometimes the fragment can also get into @B_com#google#android#gms#wallet#fragment#WalletFragmentState#WALLET_UNAVAILABLE_E@ when the Wallet service is temporarily not available. UI components will be disabled in this state. You may receive state transition updates by setting a @B_com#google#android#gms#wallet#fragment#SupportWalletFragment#OnStateChangedListener_E@ via @B_com#google#android#gms#wallet#fragment#SupportWalletFragment#setOnStateChangedListener_E@. To use this class, you must include the Android support library in your build path.
